extendedIngredients.name: herbs
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ cup rondelé® by Président® Light Garlic & Herbs Gourmet Spread

extendedIngredients.name: red pepper flakes
extendedIngredients.originalString: ¼ tsp. red pepper flakes, or less to taste

extendedIngredients.name: tomato paste
extendedIngredients.originalString: 1 tbsp. tomato paste (I used double concentrated)

recipes.title: Quick Gnocchi in Easy Tomato Cream Sauce

winePairing.pairingText: Chianti, Trebbiano, and Verdicchio are my top picks for Gnocchi. Italians know food and they know wine. Trebbiano and Verdicchio are Italian white wines that pair well with fish and white meat, while Chianti is a great Italian red for heavier, bolder dishes. You could try Castello di Volpaia Chianti Classico Riserva. Reviewers quite like it with a 4.1 out of 5 star rating and a price of about 24 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Castello di Volpaia Chianti Classico Riserva
productMatches.description: Color: Ruby red with a trace of garnet Nose: Elegant and intense with hints of spices connected with fruity scents Taste: Good structure with evident tannins and long persistence

recipes.instructions: Bring a large pot of water to a boil. Add gnocchi, and cook until they float to the top (just a few minutes). Drain and set aside.Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick pan. Add the garlic, and quickly sauté about one minute. (Be ready with a lid because the oil may splatter.)Add the tomato paste and sauce, pepper flakes, and salt. Heat for 3-4 minutes.Turn off the heat. Add about the rondelé® cheese and half of the basil. Stir until the cheese is incorporated, approximately 1 minute. Add gnocchi to the pan, and stir to coat.Top individual portions with remaining basil.

steps.step: Bring a large pot of water to a boil.
Add gnocchi, and cook until they float to the top (just a few minutes).
Heat the olive oil in a large non-stick pan.
Add the garlic, and quickly sauté about one minute. (Be ready with a lid because the oil may splatter.)
Add the tomato paste and sauce, pepper flakes, and salt.
Heat for 3-4 minutes.Turn off the heat.
Add about the rondelé® cheese and half of the basil. Stir until the cheese is incorporated, approximately 1 minute.
Add gnocchi to the pan, and stir to coat.Top individual portions with remaining basil.
